text: The striped barb (Desmopuntius johorensis),Kottelat, M. (2013): The Fishes of the Inland Waters of Southeast Asia: A Catalogue and Core Bibliography of the Fishes Known to Occur in Freshwaters, Mangroves and Estuaries. The Raffles Bulletin of Zoology, 2013, Supplement No. 27: 1–663. is a species of cyprinid fish Cyprinidae native to the Malay Peninsula to Borneo where it is found in the shallows of rivers, streams and ditches. This species can reach a length of TL. It is commercially important to local fisheries and can also be found in the aquarium trade. ==References== Category:Desmopuntius Category:Fish of Thailand Category:Fish described in 1904
title: Striped barb
